image.altText: A walkway in the St Kilda Mangrove Trail.

props.synopsis: A salt mining company has paid $100,000 as part of a civil settlement following the dieback of hectares of mangrove forest in Adelaide's north.

title.children: EPA reaches $100k settlement with salt mining company over mangrove forest dieback

image.altText: Tjulapi Alison Carroll holding a microphone while sitting in a row of people

props.synopsis: Hundreds of Indigenous doctors have converged from across the globe to share their tips for good health.

title.children: Indigenous doctors from across the globe point to the benefits of first languages in health

image.altText: India cricketer Virat Kohli runs off the Adelaide Oval in front of fans at training before the second Test against Australia.

props.synopsis: Indian team management wants fans to be kept away from the Test team's training sessions to cut down on distractions, according to Cricket Australia.

title.children: India bans fans from training sessions for Border Gavaskar Test series

image.altText: A man in a black t-shirt standing in a gym.

props.synopsis: Clifford Neumann will spend more than 20 years in jail after planning and carrying out the murder of mother-of-five Victoria Stewart.

title.children: Clifford Neumann sentenced to 20 years in jail for murdering Victoria Stewart

image.altText: Raina Cruise wearing sunglasses outdoors

props.synopsis: Raina Cruise has been given a good behaviour bond for assaulting a police officer and two security guards while "particularly fired-up" after attending an anti-COVID vaccination rally in 2021.

title.children: Failed senate candidate avoids immediate jail for assaulting police officer, security guards

image.altText: A paper list of household costs, with money and a coffee on the side of the paper.

props.synopsis: Would you ask your children to pay to stay at home? As many Australians navigate tricky conversations about cost of living pressures, some say it needs to start with an open and honest discussion about household finances.

title.children: Parents debate if teenagers should pay board as more stay home for longer

image.altText: man in van with mobile phone sitting on lap

props.synopsis: Mobile detection cameras have so far caught thousands of drivers using their phones illegally in Adelaide. But some have discovered you might still be doing the wrong thing, even if you are not touching your phone with your hands.

title.children: 'I was quite shocked': Drivers in Adelaide receive fines, demerit points for resting phones on laps

image.altText: A green and yellow ambulance driving on a road

props.synopsis: The ramping crisis which first emerged in Adelaide 15 years ago is "not about people coming in with a cut finger" but a global issue requiring broader solutions than bigger hospitals, an inquest into the deaths of three people has heard.

title.children: 'I can't breathe': Inquest into ramping reveals extent of crisis in South Australia with 'no simple solution'

image.altText: A graphic of a speed limit for a 90kph zone.

props.synopsis: Driving in later life can bring its own challenges, and while rules around older road users vary widely across the country, options for navigating those challenges include licence assessments and conversations around so-called "driving retirement".

title.children: What are the rules for older Australian drivers?

image.altText: a speed sign saying gravel roads require a max speed of 80 kilometres per hour

props.synopsis: A farmer living in rural South Australia has recently helped several drivers out of sticky situations along the unsealed roads near his home. He says they've been led astray by the GPS directions.

title.children: Travellers urged to be more cautious of GPS directions when it comes to unsealed roads

image.altText: A boy with brown curly hair wearing a navy polo shirt holds a white model of a spikey puffer fish.

props.synopsis: 3D printing technology is revolutionising the way that blind and low-vision students learn about the world around them.

title.children: How 3D models are becoming a 'game changer' for vision-impaired students

image.altText: Baby Kobi sits against a white background smiling wearing a white shirt and flowery pants

props.synopsis: The "main issue" for police handling domestic violence matters is finding a way to encourage coercive control victims to confide in them when non-contact orders have been breached, a senior police officer has told the inquest into the murder-suicide of Kobi and Henry Shepherdson.

title.children: Senior police officer tells inquest DV victims must be encouraged to report non-contact breaches

image.altText: Powerlines built through a clearing in a forest

props.synopsis: The South Australian government is urgently seeking to restart two mothballed diesel-powered generators as it warns the state is at risk of blackouts this summer.

title.children: SA government seeks new powers to get diesel generators back online ahead of peak summer period

image.altText: The sun beams through buildings on Adelaide's Hindley Street.

props.synopsis: With parts of the country already sweltering though heatwaves, support services are worried many people will not be able to afford to keep cool this year.

title.children: Above-average summer temperatures prompt concerns more Australians at risk of heat-related injuries

image.altText: Composite picture of Angus Taylor, Michele Bullock and Jim Chalmers

props.synopsis: Australia's latest national accounts show why we probably would have had to be in recession to have seen an interest rate cut this year.

title.children: What spending would you cut in a 'sad economy without much hope'?

image.altText: A CCTV image of a man holding up a gun on the footpath in Manhattan, wearing a hoodie.

props.synopsis: Brian Thompson, the chief executive of UnitedHealthcare, was on his way to a corporate meeting when he was attacked.

title.children: Manhunt underway in New York after CEO of largest US health insurer shot dead

image.altText: A man carries a blue and beige box with Arabic writing.

props.synopsis: An ABC NEWS Verify investigation has found advertisements linking the UN's aid agency in Palestine, UNWRA, with Hamas on Australian websites. It's part of a global ad campaign to discredit the agency.

title.children: UN aid agency slams pro-Israel ads in Australian media that accuse it of funding terrorism

image.altText: Smoke billows from a neighbourhood in a Syrian city with a mosque in the foreground.

props.synopsis: Islamist rebels have been advancing through large swathes of the country's north-west in the past week, threatening the rule of Syria's long-time president, Bashar Al-Assad.

title.children: Syrian forces attempt to defend strategic city after rebels stage biggest advance in years

image.altText: Matildas players congratulate Tash Prior on her first goal for the Matildas.

props.synopsis: Interim coach Tom Sermanni gives us a glimpse of the future he promised, as two streaks end for the Matildas against Chinese Taipei. Here are five quick hits from the friendly victory at Melbourne Rectangular Stadium.

title.children: Five quick hits: Two streaks end for the Matildas as unrecognisable side of young stars scores victory

image.altText: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and Redflow CEO Tim Harris.

props.synopsis: Redflow had political backing and a soaring ambition to sell energy storage to the world, but its $10,000 batteries regularly failed within months of installation leaving customers out of pocket.

title.children: Collapse of Australian battery manufacturer leaves jaded customers with broken goods

image.altText: With red running track visible in background, a child sits with legs crossed and hands propping up bowed head.

props.synopsis: State and territory governments are under pressure to step in and fund compensation for victims of child sexual abuse as institutions refuse to join the national scheme.

title.children: Deal to compensate child abuse victims of sporting groups failed after just one jurisdiction held out

image.altText: A smiling, dark-haired woman behind the bar in a country pub.

props.synopsis: Some publicans in NSW are ready to lose revenue in order to prioritise social connections. Should they be entitled to tax breaks for refusing to allow the destructive force in their venues?

title.children: These country pubs are surviving without poker-machine profits, but it's a battle against the odds

image.altText: NSW Premier Chris Minns speaks to the media during a press conference at Rosehill Gardens Racecourse December 7, 2023

props.synopsis: The parliamentary committee looking at the development proposal has voted to make the referral in its report which will be released on Friday.

title.children: Chris Minns says referral to corruption watchdog over Rosehill development 'completely unsubstantiated'

image.altText: Two small boats with divers abroad approach a large underwater shipwreck

props.synopsis: It's two months since the Royal New Zealand Navy vessel Manawanui ran aground and sank off the coast of Samoa — and locals say they can still "smell the fuel".

title.children: 'We're being ignored': Samoan village threatens to sue over NZ Navy ship sinking

image.altText: A court sketch of a woman with dark skin in a suit flanked by two police officer.

props.synopsis: A court in Japan finds Australian grandmother Donna Nelson guilty of importing two kilograms of methamphetamine into the country.

title.children: Australian who said she was tricked into smuggling drugs into Japan jailed for six years

image.altText: Pedestrians

props.synopsis: Australia's economy is growing at its slowest pace in decades, with government support keeping households afloat.

title.children: Australia's economy growing at slowest pace in decades, propped up by government spending

image.altText: Dash smiles in a crowd at a music festival, the stage behind her.

props.synopsis: Young Australians are taking the opioid reversal drug naloxone with them on nights out. We've unpacked what it is and how it works, and busted some myths along the way.

title.children: 'Everyone was freaking out, screaming': Naloxone nasal spray may save lives

image.altText: Generic TV still of 2 anonymous students writing at school desk at unidentified Qld primary school.

props.synopsis: Girls have fallen behind boys in both maths and science subjects, making Australia's education gender gap the worst in the world, the latest results from a long-running international test show.

title.children: 'Interesting and disappointing': Gap between girls and boys in STEM subjects growing, report shows

image.altText: Taylor Swift in a black and white image, not smiling, looking over her shoulder, long blonde hair

props.synopsis: Taylor Swift is the most listened-to artist for a second year in a row, according to Spotify Wrapped 2024. In Australia, The Wiggles, The Kid LAROI and AC/DC were the most streamed local artists. See how your listening habits stack up.

title.children: Spotify Wrapped gives an insight into what Australians and the world listened to in 2024

image.altText: A Commonwealth Bank branch in Melbourne's CBD

props.synopsis: Australia's biggest bank has paused its plans to charge customers a $3 fee to withdraw their own money at bank branches around the country, a day after it was announced.

title.children: Commonwealth Bank pauses plans to charge customers $3 fee to withdraw cash

image.altText: Alan Jones leaves Day Street police station on bail with lawyer Bryan Wrench, Christopher Murphy

props.synopsis: Court documents have shed slightly more light on the historical charges laid against broadcaster Alan Jones, including allegations he touched or fondled complainants' genitals and squeezed bottoms.

title.children: Court documents reveal more details about historical charges laid against broadcaster Alan Jones

image.altText: An image of a bald man with a beard and black suit smiling towards the camera.

props.synopsis: A Sydney school principal and his brother-in-law are accused of mismanaging up to $1.4 million in funds intended for maintenance and building works at two high schools.

title.children: Sydney principal accused of defrauding $1.4 million from education department in elaborate scheme

image.altText: A court sketch of Perry Koroumbilis

props.synopsis: Nearly 48 years after two women were stabbed to death in their Melbourne home, the man accused of carrying out the killings has been charged and faced court for the first time.

title.children: Easey Street accused faces court charged with murder, rape over 1977 killings

image.altText: Jasmine wears a pale yellow button-up shirt while standing in a portrait.

props.synopsis: Designer Jasmine Dowling held off on buying a house but by the time she did, Brisbane's property prices had doubled.

title.children: Imagine not being paid for 90 days. For Jasmine, it's a regular challenge
